entry.title: NEEWOLLAH PARADE EVENT NEXT TUESDAY BEGAN 90 YEARS AGO
entry.summary: October 25, 2023 11:00 a.m. The Neewollah Parade is happening next Tuesday night on Halloween, 90 years after it began. A City of Roseburg release said the annual parade started on October 31st, 1933. According to local residents, historians and newspaper articles, it has been held every year since, except during World War II and...

entry.title: PACIFIC POWER RETURNS SYSTEM SETTINGS TO NORMAL
entry.summary: October 25, 2023 10:30 a.m. Pacific Power has returned equipment settings to normal, due to the recent change in the weather. A release said that during wildfire season, the utility took extra safety precautions to reduce the risk of wildfire. In areas with elevated risk, equipment was placed on more sensitive settings that de-energized power...

entry.title: COUNTY EMPLOYERS ADD 160 JOBS IN SEPTEMBER
entry.summary: October 25, 2023 10:20 a.m. Douglas County payroll employment increased a seasonally adjusted 160 jobs in September after increases of 160 jobs in August and 30 in July. entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE BOOMER WRIGHT ANNOUNCES BID FOR RE-ELECTION
entry.summary: October 25, 2023 9:40 a.m. On Tuesday, State Representative Boomer Wright announced his bid for re-election. entry.summary: Those wishing to distribute fliers, pamphlets and other printed materials in Roseburg parks will soon be allowed to do so in compliance with city regulations — but only within designated areas at each park.

entry.title: Shades of bipolar gray
entry.summary: The two extremes of human emotional illness, mania and melancholy, have long been recognized. The ancient Greek physician Hippocrates described their symptoms over 2,500 years ago. However, the two were not always seen as being related to each other.

entry.title: HillCrest Vineyard aged like fine wine
